fr.sorbonne_u.components.hem2022e1.equipments.hem

Class HeaterConnector

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.components.connectors.AbstractConnector
      • fr.sorbonne_u.components.hem2022e1.equipments.hem.HeaterConnector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    fr.sorbonne_u.components.connectors.ConnectorI, StandardEquipmentControlCI, SuspensionEquipmentControlCI, fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.ComponentInterface, fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.RequiredCI

    public class HeaterConnector
extends fr.sorbonne_u.components.connectors.AbstractConnector
implements SuspensionEquipmentControlCI
    The class HeaterConnector manually implements a connector bridging the gap between the given generic component interface SuspensionEquipmentControlCIand the actual component interface offered by the thermostated heater component (HeaterCI).

    Description

    The code given here illustrates how a connector can be used to implement a required interface given some offered interface that is different. The objective is to be able to automatically generate such a connector at run-time from an XML descriptor of the required adjustments.

    Invariant

     invariant       true        // no more invariant

    Created on : 2021-09-13

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected boolean isSuspended
      true if the heater has been suspended, false otherwise.
      protected static double MAX_ADMISSIBLE_DELTA
      the maximal admissible difference between the target and the current temperature from which the heater should be resumed in priority after being suspended to save energy.
      protected static double MIN_ADMISSIBLE_TEMP
      the minimum admissible temperature from which the heater should be resumed in priority after being suspended to save energy.
